item.title: ActiveRAG: Autonomously Knowledge Assimilation and Accommodation through Retrieval-Augmented Agents
item.description: This paper presents ActiveRAG, a multi-agent framework designed to enhance Large Language Models (LLMs) by allowing them to actively engage with and learn from retrieved evidence, overcoming the limitations of traditional RAG models that treat LLMs as passive recipients. The framework demonstrates a 10% performance improvement on question-answering tasks and successfully mitigates the challenges posed by noisy retrieved content.
